context_bundle.summary: Lightweight open-source TODO, cron scheduling, and workflow visualization tools for Windows developers. Covers Super Productivity, n8n, Cronicle-Edge, Taskwarrior, Wexflow, Vikunja, and integration patterns.

onboarding.quick_start: Lightest: Taskwarrior (sub-10MB) + Dkron (20-50MB) + Wexflow (256MB). Easiest Windows: Super Productivity via MS Store. Best visualization: n8n for workflows, Cronicle-Edge for cron. Install n8n: npx n8n or docker run -it --rm -p 5678:5678 n8nio/n8n
common_patterns: Super Productivity: MS Store install, GitHub sync, Pomodoro timers, 100-150MB RAM
n8n: npx n8n or Docker, 500+ integrations, visual workflow builder, 512MB-2GB RAM
Cronicle-Edge: Docker, Windows cron replacement, live job monitoring, 50-100MB RAM
Taskwarrior: CLI-first, sub-10MB, Git hooks, WSL/Chocolatey install
Wexflow: .NET native, Windows installer, 100+ activities, 256-512MB RAM
Dkron: Single Go binary, 20-50MB, native Windows, distributed scheduling
known_errors: n8n node-gyp issues on Windows 11 - use Docker instead
Taskwarrior requires WSL or Chocolatey on Windows
Heavy tools (Plane 4-8GB, OpenProject 4-8GB) overkill for solo devs
